projectsList.name: Sign Language to Text
projectsList.description: Sign language recognition system that translates hand gestures into text in real time using computer vision and machine learning models.
descriptions: The project captures sign language gestures through a camera and applies computer vision techniques to extract hand keypoints.
The extracted data is processed using machine learning models trained to recognize motion sequences and convert them into readable text.
The prototype was designed as a solution to address communication challenges faced by people who communicate using sign language.

certificationsList.title: Full-Stack Developer
description: As part of my training in the FSDI program, I acquired strong skills in software and web application development.
I specialized as a full-stack web developer, covering all levels of development: from the user interface (UI) and front-end, to business logic in the middle layer and back-end.

During the program, I worked with key technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, React, ASP.NET, and Python, as well as essential tools like GitHub and agile methodologies such as Scrum and Agile.

certificationsList.title: Learn Backend Programming in C# .NET
description: During the course 'Learn Backend Programming in C# .NET', I developed strong skills in backend application development using the .NET ecosystem.
I focused on building APIs, managing databases, handling dependency control, and software architecture, applying object-oriented programming principles in C#.
Throughout the course, I worked with key technologies such as C#, .NET, Entity Framework, LINQ, and SQL Server, as well as tools like Visual Studio and Git for version control.
